Compute theoretical sample sizes from factor level standard deviations

Source: R/tidyMS_stats.R
lfq_power_t_test_proteins.Rd

Compute theoretical sample sizes from factor level standard deviations

lfq_power_t_test_proteins(
  stats_res,
  delta = c(0.59, 1, 2),
  power = 0.8,
  sig.level = 0.05,
  min.n = 1.5
)

Arguments

stats_res

data.frame `summarize_stats` output
delta

effect size you are interested in
power

of test
min.n

smallest n to determine
sigma.level

P-Value

See also

Other stats: INTERNAL_FUNCTIONS_BY_FAMILY, compute_pooled(), lfq_power_t_test_quantiles_V2(), lfq_power_t_test_quantiles(), plot_stat_density_median(), plot_stat_density(), plot_stat_violin_median(), plot_stat_violin(), plot_stdv_vs_mean(), poolvar(), summarize_stats_all(), summarize_stats_quantiles(), summarize_stats()

Examples

library(prolfqua)
library(tidyverse)
bb1 <- prolfqua::data_ionstar$normalized()
config <- bb1$config$clone( deep = TRUE)
data2 <- bb1$data
stats_res <- summarize_stats(data2, config)

#> completing cases
bb <- lfq_power_t_test_proteins(stats_res)
head(bb)

#> # A tibble: 6 x 11
#>   protein_Id  peptide_Id dilution.     n not_na    sd   var   mean delta N_exact
#>   <chr>       <chr>      <chr>     <int>  <int> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>

#> 3 CON__P0103~ ILSLAQDQV~ b             4      4 0.544 0.296 -1.03   0.59   14.4 
#> 4 CON__P0103~ ILSLAQDQV~ c             4      4 0.384 0.148 -1.15   0.59    7.74
#> 5 CON__P0103~ ILSLAQDQV~ d             4      4 0.391 0.153 -1.41   0.59    7.97
#> 6 CON__P0103~ ILSLAQDQV~ e             4      4 0.403 0.162 -1.35   0.59    8.40
